synopsis.text: Hajime Aono was once a prized young violin prodigy, but he abandoned music after his famous violinist father left the family. Now a third-year middle school student, Hajime struggles to decide his career path. When he meets the passionate novice violinist Ritsuko Akine, she inspires him to reconnect with violin playing. Ritsuko dreams of attending the prestigious high school Umimaku for its renowned orchestra club. As Hajime helps Ritsuko improve her skills, he finds himself gradually falling in love with music again. Seeking a fresh start, Hajime decides to take the entrance exam for Umimaku as well. There he encounters gifted musicians like Ritsuko who share his passion for the violin. Though haunted by memories of his father, with the support of his new friends Hajime begins to heal. Together, the members of the orchestra club help each other overcome their personal demons and family issues. As they practice and perform classical masterpieces, the students learn to play in harmony, both onstage and off. This coming-of-age drama follows a group of teenagers as they bond through their shared love of music. Though once disheartened, Hajime regains his passion for the violin. Surrounded by this tight-knit community, he continues on the road to becoming a virtuoso like his father before him.
synopsis.author: anthropic.claude-v2:1
